abstracts.cdata!:
The Regional Trade Facilitation Project
            will contribute to poverty alleviation, through private
            sector led growth in the participating countries, by
            improving access to financing for productive transactions,
            and cross-border trade. The two components will: 1) Support
            the establishment of a regional political insurance
            facility, to be implemented, and managed by a multilateral
            agency, i.e., the African Trade Insurance Agency (ATI). The
            facility will cover productive activity involving
            cross-border trade, and, political/non-commercial risks,
            which include inter alia, inability to convert, or transfer
            currency; imposition of exchange controls; cancellation of
            licenses/restrictions on import/export; and, seizure of
            goods, prevention of sale, or of export. 2) ATI's
            operating, and capital costs will be shared by the
            participating countries, and a credit from the International
            Development Association (IDA) will cover the start-up period
            of ATI's operation. Each country's share will be
            proportional to the level of ATI's activity, related to
            transaction, covering imports into, and exports out of each
            country. A fund will be created for capital expenses to be
            incurred during the life of the project.
